reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying on an All Inclusive basis, and it's hard to believe that we stayed the same week as Frances 2355. The week didn't start well as we had rain and then thunder and lightning for the first 3 days and maybe that made us more critical but from our arrival the staff on reception were surly. To get to our room from reception we had to go up 6 stairs to a very small lift, which took 1 person and 1 suitcase. We were on the 3rd floor of the furthest away block at the end of the corridor. We arrived just after 12 noon but had to wait until 2 pm to get to our room. The room was very nice, no problem there, although the towels in the bathroom were very thin. Use once and they were wet (not damp, wet). The food in the restaurant was very good with plenty of choice at all meals and if you didn't want a full lunch you could have sandwiches from the pool bar, which were very tasty. The service in the restaurant could be a bit 'hitty missy' depending on where you were sitting, but overall it was good. The Greek night and the Italian night in the restaurant were excellent. The restaurant was down stairs again and to get to the pool and pool bar it was down stairs and more stairs. The beach was down a long slope and then down 82 steps. To get pool towels you had to pay 20 euros at reception, receive a card, take that to the pool bar and receive 2 towels which had to last 2 days. On one of the days we had to change the towels we were given 2 towels that had had the tops torn off! On the last day you do the whole process in reverse - towels to bar, card returned, back to reception to get your 20 euros back (which in our case was 'plonked' on the counter 3 feet from where we were standing!) The drinks, what can I say, the lager was refreshing, but weak and the spirits at nightime varied so much that we wondered some evenings just what we were drinking! The entertainment was something else - 1 night we had a quiz, another night we played bingo, we had 2 nights of a man playing the piano, but half the time we couldn't make out what he was playing, 1 night of 3 singers singing like Il Divo (this was EXCELLENT), 1 night of Greek dancers (this was OK) and 1 night of a guy playing a guitar and singing along to very loud music, however he had a good beat and plenty people were up dancing! The beach was lovely, plenty of beds and umbrellas and the sea water was warm and crystal clear. There were quite a few wasps, but the bar man who was well surrounded by them said they were not aggressive! I only got bitten 3 times by mozzies but some people were covered in bites so take plenty of sprays with you if you are going to this hotel/area. Overall we just felt that the hotel had too many people for the facilities that it had. One thing they did forget to mention in the brochure was that you had to wait until 11 am for the sun to get to the beach due to the beautiful hilly scenery behind the hotel, but when it did come out it was lovely and hot! We did not feel that this hotel was up to Platinum standard (or what we expected for Platinum standard) and we will not be returning for another holiday, but some people we spoke to had been to that hotel 4 times which just proves that old saying 'You can't please all of the people all of the time'!
reviews.title: Platinum this was not!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the adult only Aquis Agios Gordios Beach Hotel in Agios Gordios, Corfu tel +30 26611 80000 was from 14th to 21st October 2012 and after booking we realised that this time of the year you should expect some rain. When we arrived on the Sunday it was raining and this followed by thunder storms that evening but the rest of the week really improved.
reviews.title: October 2012 at Aquis Agios Gordios Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel:
reviews.title: very good holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: We upgraded and stayed in a very nice modern bungalow room 8xxx with a main large living room, separate bedroom, bathroom and shower, two TVs with DVD players and two aircon units. UK TV channel restricted to BBC World. Tea and Coffee replenished each day. Free Wifi internet available all over the hotel including your room. We were really pleased with the bungalow BUT its up a very steep hill and not an easy climb each day! If upgrading and have difficulty climbing then make sure the hotel is aware and ask for a lower bungalow. Staff are all very helpful.
reviews.title: Outstanding!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rest of the hotel is built on the side of a cliff face, you enter at reception on the 5th floor and the lift takes you down to 1st floor which is a level above the swimming pool. There is then a long walk down to the beach and bar.
reviews.title: good all round,for me

reviews.text: Food:
reviews.title: IDYLLIC SETTING !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a week away to grab the last of the sun, this was perfect. Lovely pool area (pool cool though), steps to beach and warm sea, fantastic views, good food choice, friendly pleasant staff, great. Rooms are good with comfy beds, and a balcony. Bathroom a bit tight and bring your own shampoo. Yes there are alot of steps, which some have moaned about, but the hotel is built into the side of a cliff, so only to be expected. We met some lovely people on this holiday and would recommend it.
reviews.title: Excellent value and fantastic views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks all inclusive. After reading some of the reviews we were slightly worried. However a holiday is what you make it and we had a great time. The room was fantastic with breathtaking views in a small block away from the main hotel, it felt very private with no other rooms in sight. Maid service was very good and the room was cleaned daily. we had no issues with towels or bed changes. The beach was very clean and the sea warm and clear, we swam every day. The hotel charges 10 euros deposit for a beach towel, the money being refunded at the end of your stay. The waiters and waitresses and and all the staff were very happy and friendly and would do anything to help you enjoy your stay.
reviews.title: very relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The village is a short walk away, along the beach or along the road at the back of the hotel, for us it was an easy walk, however if you have mobility problems then this is not the hotel for you. I would go so far as to say that in the heat of the day, if you are overweight then it will be a problem for you to get to the village or to and from the beach.
reviews.title: jackied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst we were there we noticed several people with walking sticks and they seemed to be having a few problems getting to rooms and the dining room too as there are a lot of stairs in the hotel.
reviews.title: A Fab Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wasps were there of course... there are always wasps in Greece, but if you gently shoo them away they fly off and were not a problem. There were mosquitos too, so you will need to take some repellent. Also take wasp-eze, and paracetamol , as the nearest chemist is in the next village about 2 km away.
reviews.title: We would return
